> Q: What pathway has the most significant “Entities p-value”? Do the most significant pathways listed match your previous KEGG results? What factors could cause differences between the two methods?

The Reactome pathway with the most significant Entities p-value was Cell Cycle (Entities p-value: 2.65×10⁻⁵). This is consistent with my earlier KEGG analysis, where the Cell Cycle pathway (hsa04110) was also one of the top enriched pathways. However, Reactome additionally identified more specific sub-pathways such as Cell Cycle, Mitotic; Cell Cycle Checkpoints; Mitotic Prometaphase; and Mitotic Spindle Checkpoint, which are not represented as separate pathways in KEGG. Differences in pathway size, curation methods, and statistical models can contribute to the discrepancies between the two analyses.
